meanings.definition: To rent out (a property) for too high a price.
meanings.sent1: She was overletting her apartment, making it difficult for tenants to afford.
meanings.sent2: The landlord realized he was overletting the house when no one was interested in renting it.
meanings.sent3: The overletting of the office space led to a comical situation where no one could afford to work there.
meanings.sent4: His greed for profit resulted in overletting the property, leaving it vacant for months.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overletting were evident as the once bustling building now stood empty and neglected.

meanings.definition: The act of renting out a property for too high a price.
meanings.sent1: The overletting of the apartment caused many potential tenants to look elsewhere.
meanings.sent2: Overletting in the city had become a common issue, driving up housing costs for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The overletting of the beach house was so extreme that even the wealthy hesitated to rent it.
meanings.sent4: The overletting of the property was like trying to sell ice to Eskimos, no one was interested.
meanings.sent5: The negative effects of overletting were felt throughout the neighborhood, causing unrest among residents.
